title.narrative: People benefited from improved or new resilient infrastructure, of which female.
Southern Brazil municipal subprojects supported by the Project.
BRDE staff trained in Urban Resilience and/o Disaster Risk Management, of which female.
Municipal staff trained in Urban Resilience and/or Disaster Risk Management as part of Project implementation, of which female, compared to gender distribution of municipal staff.
Disaster Risk Management knowledge products developed as part of the Project.
Natural hazard monitoring equipment or systems acquired, installed and functioning as part of Project implementation.
People transferred from disaster-prone to risk-free areas as result of Project implementation, of which female.
Detailed project designs financed by the Project.
Area directly benefited from the drainage infrastructure built or upgraded as result of Project implementation.
Area directly benefited from the landslide mitigation infrastructure built or upgraded as result of Project implementation.
Percentage of beneficiaries, particularly women participating in subprojects Stakeholder Engagement Plans activities, who report subproject investments/ reflected their needs
Proportion of women participating in subprojects Stakeholder Engagement Plans activities held in disaster risk areas
Grievances related to the Project recorded in the GRM system that are processed and communicated back to the concerned stakeholder within twenty business days
